headline.main: TRADE IN WARSHIPS OFFICIALLY DENIED; Roosevelt, Hull, Knox, Stark Spike Swap of 20 Destroyers for H.M.S. King George V BROADER DEAL IS TALKED Report Persists of an Eventual Exchange of Cruisers for Needed Heavy Battleships

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 -- Reports that the United States Government planned to trade twenty Navy destroyers for the British battleship King George V were denied today by President Roosevelt, Secretaries Hull and Knox and Admiral Harold B. Stark, Chief of Naval Operations.
abstract: trade of destroyers and light warships for HMS King George V and other Brit battleships rumor denied by Roosevelt, Secs Hull and Knox and Adm Stark
